meanings.definition: To advise or warn against something.
meanings.sent1: I dehorts my friend from eating too much candy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher dehorts us to study hard for the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: Mom dehorts me from staying up too late by reminding me of the importance of sleep.
meanings.sent4: The sign dehorts visitors from feeding the animals at the zoo.
meanings.sent5: The doctor dehorts patients from smoking to improve their health.

meanings.sent1: She dehorts her brother from skipping school.
meanings.sent2: The coach dehorts the team from giving up during the game.
meanings.sent3: The rain dehorts the picnic plans, but we can have fun indoors instead.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds dehorts us from going to the beach today.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise dehorts the birds from nesting in the tree.
